title: Grade 5 Math Data Management and Probability

questions.definition: A chart that uses rectangular bars to represent data values.
A graph that uses points connected by lines to show how something changes over time.
A circular chart divided into sectors, each representing a proportion of the whole.
The average of a set of numbers, found by dividing the sum of the numbers by the count of numbers.
The middle value in a set of numbers arranged in ascending or descending order.
The number that appears most frequently in a data set.
The difference between the highest and lowest values in a data set.
The likelihood or chance of an event occurring, expressed as a fraction, decimal, or percentage.
An event that will definitely happen; probability of 1 or 100%.
An event that cannot happen; probability of 0 or 0%.
An event that has a high chance of occurring but is not certain.
An event that has a low chance of occurring but is not impossible.
A possible result of a probability experiment.
A set of one or more outcomes in a probability experiment.
The set of all possible outcomes in a probability experiment.
A table that uses tally marks to record frequencies.
A table that lists items and shows the number of times they occur.
A method of collecting data by asking people questions.
A bar graph that shows the frequency of data within equal intervals.
A graph that uses pictures or symbols to represent data.
A graph that uses line segments to show changes in data over time.
